media/user/SCRAPE/test/2019-05-vaiapraia-e-as-rainhas-do-baile/extracted/Vaiapraia e as Rainas do Baile/03 Fantasmas Sem Armas
Vaiapraia e as Rainhas do Baile - Amor Duro
Vaiapraia e as Rainhas do Baile
Vaiapraia e as Rainhas do Baile - Amor Duro

Originally ripped by Terminal Escape, posted on May 21, 2019 Description from Terminal Escape:
Rarely am I rendered as speechless as I was when I first listened to Amor Duro. The songs are simply crafted, reminiscent of the more interesting early '90s college/alt greats, particularly on "Sem Armas" (I'm talking Rid Of Me-era PJ HARVEY, maybe TEENAGE FANCLUB). But here's the thing that really grabbed me: Amor Duro listens like a complete and completely formed release, but "Sem Armas" is kinda the only song. There's the title track that opens the tape, but it comes off more like an introduction...an ominous sounding three note repetition with wailing vocals that border on BIRTHDAY PARTY caliber magnetism, and then after "Sem Armas" comes "Fantasmas Sem Armas," an mystical re-imagination of the previous number that turns what was, as its roots, essentially a laid back indie/grunge number into a fully engrossing ambient journey. Portugal's VAIAPRAIA take the elements that feel and sound familiar and twist them into something completely different...but still completely familiar. The internet offers a deep hole that only makes VAIAPRAIA E AS RAINHAS DO BAILE more intriguing....so happy digging.  AMOR DURO
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qcGfGx7Eocw https://vaiapraia.bandcamp.com/music
